meanings.definition: Relating to the removal of objectionable material.
meanings.sent1: The teacher used an expurgatorial approach to edit the inappropriate content from the student's essay.
meanings.sent2: The expurgatorial process ensured that the book was suitable for young readers.
meanings.sent3: The expurgatorial editing of the movie made it suitable for all audiences to enjoy.
meanings.sent4: Her expurgatorial actions on social media helped maintain a positive online presence.
meanings.sent5: The expurgatorial filter on the website blocked any harmful content from being displayed.

meanings.definition: Serving to cleanse or purify by removing offensive material.
meanings.sent1: The expurgatorial soap removed all the dirt and grime from the kitchen counter.
meanings.sent2: His expurgatorial efforts in the community helped improve the overall environment.
meanings.sent3: The expurgatorial spray cleaned the windows so well that they sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The expurgatorial effect of her words cleared the air and resolved the misunderstanding.
meanings.sent5: The expurgatorial power of forgiveness washed away all the bitterness and resentment.
